title: Happy birthday Yorick!
body:
It's been now exactly 6 years since {{champion:83}} got his last skin. 

Let's hope this will be his lucky year C:

replies.body: I heard his upcoming skin comes with a free copy of half life three!

Yes, they already announced it will be released in the 7.69 patch that will also remove Yasuo from the game and present the first widely accepted Roster Update alongside successful Vel'Koz rework.

EDIT: OMG I forgot to use sarcasm filter once again.

I'm a Mastery Level 6 Vel'Koz Main, and I really don't see anything wrong with him, and if it's the true damage passive, it's easily countered due to his lack of mobility. In fact that applies to all of his abilities. All you have to do is predict skill shots and not stand still.
Also:

> I feel like we’re tackling some major pain points this year and feel confident committing to you that you will be receiving skins for Cassiopeia, Viktor, **Yorick**, Illaoi (and more) over the next 12 months. We know there are others you would add to that list; they are likely on our list as well.

That's what _I_ want to know. >_<
Some champions are more difficult to get S with

> I'm a Mastery Level 6 Vel'Koz Main

And I'm Mastery Level 7 Vel'Koz Main. Point?

> if it's the true damage passive, it's easily countered due to his lack of mobility. In fact that applies to all of his abilities. All you have to do is predict skill shots and not stand still.

Are you really explaining this to someone called Velzard of Koz? And did you really take my post seriously?

My point is that Vel'Koz's rework isn't something that should be called into question. Did you really think I didn't read up on you? In my eyes, you were some agitated Vel'Koz main that believed he was fine where he was until Riot added a bunch of stuff they didn't need to (most likely because I've seen too many of those Rengar posts, you know the ones). I thought you were someone who got stuck in the past and hated the new stuff just because it was different. My point wasn't that you didn't know it, but that you were ignoring it in favor of the "negative" aspects.
Of course I didn't take your post seriously, it's obvious you were trying to make a joke. But the way you worded it made you seem like you were trying to chime in rather than make some witty comeback. You sounded like you were on the side of the Half Life 3 commenter, rather than trying to tell him off.
Overall, there were obviously shortcomings on both of our parts (your miscommunication, my misinterpretation), and I think we should just abandon the issue.

i miss the old saying "a good yorick walks into a bar, there was no counter"
I thought the joke was "Yorick walks into a bar, there is no counter". How 'good' did you have to be on old Yorick? He was fun, but definitely not an intricate champ.

Yorick was easily countered though not widely  known kill his ghouls first when i used to say this i got in response 'why should i have to kill his ghouls i just want to hit the champion' id have prefered riot just saying kill his ghouls first over this rework . At least the swarn version they had sounded interesting if not just like wraith king from dota 2

I don't agree with old Yorick being easily countered. Cho and Trundle were the few that could sustain through Yorick. You basically couldn't go near the champ due to the ghouls. It was just a terrible kit for everyone.

As i said the counter to old yorick was to kill his 2 hit ghouls. It is an easy counter it was not a commonly known counter. People fought him through his ghouls when he gets damage  reduction  and extra damage while they are alive and wondered why they lost the fight. They fought to his strength and wondered why the lost

The thing is though, it wasn't reasonable to simply kill his ghouls all the time because he could easily cast 3 ghouls by spamming his abilities in range which takes quite a bit to kill - the whole time you're taking damage while he's healing and pushing the lane out pushing and sustaining you. That's why Trundle and Cho did well against him because his ghouls dying would sustain them. The problem with old Yorick was that it wasn't interactive to constantly be fighting ghouls while Yorick CSed and healed, which would just auto push and win his lane, only to fall off mid/late game using his ult that no one knew how to use properly. There were so many things toxic about his gameplay. But ya, the old saying was 'Yorick walks into a bar, there is no counter', not a 'good Yorick' because the skillfloor was so low on that champion to begin with!

Only ghoul Yorick could constantly keep up is the 1 from his q and it was rarely  maxed first by Yorick players because e has sustain on it. Ghouls from W E and R all had a significant down time and if people insist todays mages dont rapid fire spells constantly despite not being ryze Yoricks Q which was his shortest cooldown  spell didnt have as low a cooldown as most mages combos. Running from yorick hoping the ghouls die isnt smart because then his spells will be back soon you have to kill his ghouls and fight him you dont have to kill all but standing in all isnt  smart. Malzahar does the same thing but stronger.
 Most of yoricks damage is front loaded into the spell cast not the ghouls so running from the ghouls after 70%Of the damage is already  dealt is redundant.

if ahead in farm amd with a little help from hit teamates he could easily win the game, passive was THE statstick of statstick passives, q w and e were minions that each did their own thing, and ur ulty was a shaco ulty with a zil ulty stapled on.  and he build pretty much everything on hit, so unless you chain cc him or run away faster than he could chase, you were a gonner

edit: also nobody knew how to play sgainst him because they never saw him

So is caitlyns current passive both of jayces paasives and darius' passive yorick had to do management of his ghouls most players mistake was ignoring the ghouls and they were horribly  bugged to the point they spent half their up times standing doing nothing often.
